definition: A three-dimensional shape that narrows smoothly from a flat circular base to a point; also the seed-bearing fruit of a pine or fir.
examples: The ice-cream melted down the cone.
A traffic cone marked the hole in the road.

definition: A solid with six equal square faces; to cut food into small square pieces.
examples: A dice is a perfect cube. (noun)
Cube the cheese for the salad. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Cube = box-shaped or chopping into boxes.

definition: The planet we live on; soil or ground; to connect electrical equipment to the ground for safety.
examples: The Earth orbits the Sun. (noun)
Plant the seeds 2 cm below the earth. (noun)
An electrician will earth the circuit. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Earth = planet, soil, or safe wiring.

definition: A green plant with feathery leaves and no flowers or seeds, reproducing with spores.
examples: Ferns grow well in shady forests.
A fern’s fronds unfurl as they grow.

definition: Material such as coal, petrol or wood that is burned for heat or power; to supply or power something.
examples: The car runs on diesel fuel. (noun)
Sunlight fuels the plant’s growth. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Fuel = energy to make things go.

definition: The small hard seed of cereals like wheat or rice; a tiny piece of something.
examples: Bread is made from grain.
There was not a grain of truth in the story.

extra.memory_tip: Grain = teeny seed of food plants.

definition: A cold-blooded reptile with scaly skin, four legs and a long tail.
examples: A lizard basked on the warm rock.
Geckos are a type of lizard.

extra.memory_tip: Lizard = scaly reptile on four legs.

definition: A person who works underground digging out coal, metal ore or other minerals.
examples: The miner wore a helmet with a lamp.
Gold miners moved to the region in the 1800s.

definition: A gift given to someone; to give or show something; existing or happening now.
examples: She unwrapped her birthday present. (noun)
The pupils will present their projects. (verb)
All members are present today. (adjective)

extra.memory_tip: Present = gift, show, or here and now.

definition: A line where two pieces of fabric or material are joined; a layer of rock or ore; to join with stitches.
examples: The trouser seam has split. (noun)
Miners followed a coal seam underground. (noun)
She seamed the edges neatly. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Seam = line of joining or hidden layer.
